title: Why are there some people who are 'not that into music'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Maybe, they don’t connect to music emotionally. Being a musician, i can understand why the notes are put the way they are and what you have to do to produce a sound on a particular instrument. I’ve played songs and sang songs in public and in private and I feel the emotion that the writer was trying to convey. People not into music don’t have that emotional connection. They listen to music and like a song, but it doesn’t stir anything in them to look past notes played together and words in a melody. My perfect example would be my sons. One is a drummer and the other is a computer/video game hobbyist. The drummer loves music; my computer son likes music but never played an instrument or sang in a chorus, so music never really touched him inside. I hope this is helpful! Markd

That are some good answers here already. I find the question challenging to answer, because “being into” something is subjective. Music speaks to people differently and it serves different purposes in their lives. As mentioned below, those highly trained as musicians have a relationship with music beyond listening pleasure. I find myself analyzing music as I hear it (what’s that chord progression, that was an unexpected interval, etc.). This doesn’t take away the joy of music for me…it enhances it. I have known people brought to tears by a piece of music, while at the same time, another person falls asleep because they are bored. As with most things, we are unique creatures with complex minds - the wondrous variety is what makes us so special!
